title: Low-Carb Sesame Tofu Stir-Fry
description: Crisp-pan seared tofu tossed with crunchy low-carb vegetables in a savory sesame-ginger sauce. Fast, satisfying stir-fry with nutty sesame flavor and bright aromatics, perfect for a weeknight low-carb dinner.

ingredients.display_name: extra-firm tofu, pressed and cut into 1-inch cubes
ingredients.notes: press at least 20 minutes to remove excess water

ingredients.display_name: red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
green onions, sliced (white and green parts separated)
ingredients.notes: slice thinly; reserve greens for garnish

ingredients.display_name: tamari (gluten-free soy sauce) or soy sauce
neutral oil (avocado or light olive oil) for frying
erythritol or monk fruit sweetener (optional low-carb sweetener)

steps.text: Press the tofu to remove excess water for at least 20 minutes using a tofu press or weighted plate with paper towels, then cut into 1-inch cubes.
While tofu presses, prepare vegetables: cut broccoli into bite-sized florets, slice bell pepper and zucchini, mince garlic and ginger, and slice white parts of green onions separately from greens.
Mix the sauce in a small bowl: combine tamari, rice vinegar, toasted sesame oil, erythritol (if using), minced garlic and ginger, and red pepper flakes; set aside.

Heat a large nonstick or well-seasoned cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, add neutral oil, then add tofu cubes in a single layer; sear without moving until golden on one side, about 3-4 minutes per side, turning to brown all sides.

Remove seared tofu to a plate and wipe skillet if excess residue; add another small splash of neutral oil if needed and add broccoli florets; stir-fry for 2 minutes until bright green and beginning to caramelize.
Add sliced bell pepper and zucchini to the pan with broccoli, continue stir-frying for about 2-3 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Return tofu to the pan, pour the prepared sauce over, toss gently to coat, and cook for another 1-2 minutes to warm through and let the sauce thicken slightly.
Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper if needed, sprinkle toasted sesame seeds and sliced green onion greens, then remove from heat and serve immediately.
